snippet: Toru Hashimoto’s view that so-called comfort women provided relief for Japanese soldiers “risking their lives” was swiftly condemned by lawmakers and human rights groups.
abstract: Toru Hashimoto, mayor of Osaka, Japan, draws outcry from human rights groups and lawmakers after he says that women forced into wartime brothels for Japanese Army during World War II had served a necessary role in providing relief for war-crazed soldiers.
lead_paragraph: Toru Hashimoto’s view that so-called comfort women provided relief for Japanese soldiers “risking their lives” was swiftly condemned by lawmakers and human rights groups.
